page.title: 17RELIGION
page.content: {Midlem Secession Church.} At the time when the great Border Abbeys were being formed, King David I of Scotland granted land at Midlem to the monks of Selkirk, who moved to Kelso in 1128. A mill, brewhouse and twenty-nine husbandlands were established at Midlem and various transactions between the monks and tenants are reported in Kelso Abbey records. { {In 1643,}Bowden Parish Church's first recorded list of Heritors includes the lairds of Midlem Mill, Kippilaw and Langside, the tenants of Clarilaw and Prieston Farms and several men of Midlem Village. Bowden Kirk being without a minister in 1739, the Duke of Roxburghe nominated James Hume but the feuars objected to his right of patronage.
